Oooooooooooohhhhh. Everyone aboard the burn train.
{{summoner:14}} Ohhh snap, did that just happen!{{summoner:14}}

Interesting work! Outside of model animations, what about debuff/CC animations? Most of them (while admittedly for the sake of clarity) seem to have a major detachment from the game. For example, when someone is silenced a bright white chat bubble will float above their head; it's obvious for good reasons but it also detracts from the visual immersion. Other effects, like knockups, sometimes feel unsatisfying because the character model is frozen while being blasted into the air. I know that newer champions have different walking/running animations depending on whether they've been slowed/hasted so it'd be great to see some flailing or unbalance of sorts when they're suddenly knocked airborne. :)
Azir and Gnar have knockup animations where they're lying on their backs and flailing their arms and legs.  They haven't been implemented, but the LoLKing model viewer has them.
Good to hear! It'd be great to have those nice animations in Live... There must be some problem with putting them into the game then?

It's mainly the sheer number of new assets. We're making progress towards it and adding them to new characters like Gnar, but filling out the backlog, getting the design-side hookups and QA all take time. We'll get there though!

Speaking of having ridiculous number of assets, another Rioter once talked about how crazy Zac was and how he required all sorts of crazy new assets, and how a bunch of stuff was created to make his gooey animations possible.


First question...what makes him so complicated? You couldn't do liquid before or something? What about Vlad's Sanguine Pool or Nami's water abilities?

Second more important question...if you even went out of your way to develop new asset to create Zac, you ever consider reusing some of the assets to make another champion similar(aesthetics-wise) to Zac? You have to admit that you could use a few more "out there" champions in terms of aesthetics.

Third and just throwing this out there...is this the reason why Zac's only skin is nothing more than *"Zac...but purple!"*?

Zac's complicated because of how his rig's set up. The joint hierarchy is very different to allow some of the blobby motion we added. There was also a lot of model swapping for his different moves as well as some of our earliest parametric anims. Vlad and Nami's effects are actually created by the VFX artists, whereas Zac was a mix of effects and animation.

For the second question, every champ is different with custom... well everything. But we learned a lot from Zac though that we still use today.

His complexity was probably part of his skin choice, but I'm not the best guy to ask
So Riot... is this new... uh... new jiggle technology going to be implemented in any... possibly female champions that are coming?
Pffft, haven't you seen {{champion:86}} Garen fight {{champion:55}} Katarina in Twist of Fate? Totes Jiggle Tech
I cannot unsee the stretching anymore!

Man, I'm really glad they posted something like this. I'm actually going to school to learn about animation and hopefully become an animator for Riot Games. It's really nice to see tricky champion animations in depth! It really shows how much work they put into champions we play everyday. Thanks Riot ^^

I really appreciate how much time and effort you have put into the various champions. It's obvious with various champion updates that you are re-creating these champions with no monetary incentive in mind. The Sion update was a a very welcome update from us, the community. 

Thanks

-Koski
